page.title: 11FARMING IN SERLBY. (2)
page.content:
{Interview with Mr Skelton. Continued.
The major hazard for his crops is that hares eat his sugar beet and wheat and barley can suffer from mildew. His main customer for his potatoes is Walker's Crisps of Leicester. The British Sugar Corporation factory at Newark takes all the sugar beet and Nicholson's take the barley. Mr Skelton doesn't keep many animals; the only livestock being 36 ewes for breeding sheep. Thirty five acres of the farm is devoted to livestock and over four hundred acres for crops. Mr Skelton has lived on the farm all his life and the farm has been passed down since his grandfather's times in 1948.He became a farmer because he has never known anything else and because he was interested in it.
